docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: These are the settings to use when exporting a Blender model to Unreal Engine 5. Export to FBX.

docs.title: Include
docs.text:
What from Blender to include in the export.

Note

You can use Selected Objects but it can be tedious to remember to select everything before exporting, especially if you need to export several times.

Danger

If you have a backup of your mesh, make sure that it is hidden when using Visible Objects.

docs.title: Transform
docs.text: The Unreal coordinate system uses different axes than Blender. Unreal uses the x axis for forward, and z axis for up.

docs.title: Geometry
docs.text: Change the smoothing from Normals to Face. This clears up a bunch of smoothing warnings in Unreal when importing the FBX model.

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text: Once the FBX is exported, it is ready to be imported into Unreal Engine 5.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Assign basic materials to the mesh. The materials will be overriden in Unreal Engine 5.
